alert.note: Alert for Brown; Marshall; Nemaha; Republic; Washington (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 16 at 2:34PM CDT until June 17 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM CDT FRIDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heat indices of 105 or greater, and overnight lows in the mid to upper 70s. * WHERE...Republic, Washington, Marshall, Nemaha and Brown Counties. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, from noon to 8 PM CDT Friday. For the Excessive Heat Watch, from Saturday afternoon through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat and humidity will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While maximum heat indices are expected to be similar each afternoon Friday through Monday, lows will continue to increase this weekend, and this prolonged period of dangerous heat will begin to compound heat-related health concerns.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this situation. Be prepared to drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air- conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. This is especially true during warm or hot weather when car interiors can reach lethal temperatures in a matter of minutes.
